Material used.Description: Transfected SK-N-SH cells were fixed after 24 h with 4% (w/v) paraformaldehyde in phosphate-buffered saline (PBS) for 5 min at 22°C and/or in 100% methanol for 5 min at -20°C and washed with PBS.

Readout description.Result Description: FLAG-Parkin(C289G) staining did not overlap with the MitoDsRed staining, as it was mainly observed in distinct intracellular inclusions. FLAG-Parkin(C289G) was expressed at slightly lower levels than Parkin(WT) and was strongly aggregation-prone. FLAG-Parkin(C289G) formed multiple large inclusions throughout the cytoplasm and nucleus in approximately 86% of cells. The RING1 domain mutant FLAG-Parkin(C289G) failed to redistribute to damaged mitochondria and could not induce mitophagy. FLAG-Parkin(C289G) and myc-HSJ1a(WT) co-expression partially rescued the relocation of FLAG-Parkin(C289G) to damaged mitochondria, with overlapping staining observed in many cells (37% after 8 h).

FLAG-Parkin(R42P) was expressed at levels similar to Parkin(WT), but showed a tendency to misfold. Parkin(R42P) aggregated into multiple small perinuclear inclusions in approximately 22% of cells. Despite this, FLAG-Parkin(R42P) was still capable of folding sufficiently to be recruited to mitochondria and retained its ability to mediate mitochondrial clustering.

Biological replicates.Description: Cells were analyzed using a Nikon Eclipse 80i fluorescence microscope quantified in four randomly chosen groups comprising at least 100 cells.

Technical replicates.Description: All experiments were carried out at least three times, and the data shown are representative of these, but generally derive from one experiment.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild Tpe was used as a positive control for the assay

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: the mean, standard deviation and standard error were calculated and statistical significance analyzed using an unpaired two-sample t-test.

Material used.Description: Transfected SK-N-SH cells were used for co-immunoprecipitation experiments.

Readout description.Result Description: FLAG-Parkin(C289G) staining did not overlap with the MitoDsRed staining, as it was mainly observed in distinct intracellular inclusions. FLAG-Parkin(C289G) and myc-HSJ1a(WT) co-expression partially rescued the relocation of FLAG-Parkin(C289G) to damaged mitochondria.

Biological replicates.Description: Cells were analyzed using a Nikon Eclipse 80i fluorescence microscope quantified in four randomly chosen groups comprising at least 100 cells.

Technical replicates.Description: All experiments were carried out at least three times, and the data shown are representative of these, but generally derive from one experiment.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild Tpe was used as a positive control for the assay

Basic negative control.Description: Parkin(C289G) without co-transfection as negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: the mean, standard deviation and standard error were calculated and statistical significance analyzed using an unpaired two-sample t-test.
